abstract: The investor Carl C. Icahn wants to remove Genzyme’s chief executive, Henri A. Termeer, from the board of the company, according to a new proxy statement filed by Mr. Icahn, who is seeking to have himself and three associates elected to Genzyme’s 10-person board at the annual meeting in June.
snippet: The investor Carl C. Icahn wants to remove Genzyme’s chief executive, Henri A. Termeer, from the board of the company, according to a new proxy statement filed by Mr. Icahn, who is seeking to have himself and three associates elected to Genzyme’s ...
lead_paragraph: The investor Carl C. Icahn wants to remove Genzyme‘s chief executive, Henri A. Termeer, from the board of the company, according to a new proxy statement filed by Mr. Icahn, Andrew Pollack reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Icahn Tries to Replace 4 Directors at Genzyme
